job_description: Manufacturing Engineer Senior / Grand Prairie, TX - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews 1701 W Marshall Dr, Grand Prairie, TX 75051 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control is seeking a Manufacturing Engineer for a position in Grand Prairie, TX to join the Precision Fires Program Manufacturing Engineering team supporting the Launchers Programs (HIMARS and/or M270). The Manufacturing Engineer will act as the Production Operations Point of Contact to various suppliers and Lockheed Martin make sites to proactively identify and work issues ahead of production impact. This position will require frequent communication and collaboration with other disciplines including Process Engineering, Design Engineering, Quality Engineering, Global Supply Chain, Finance, Production Planning and Control, Contracts, Master Planning, and Program Management. Being able to build effective relationships while working in a high-paced environment with others is essential. Evaluating Notification of Change (NOC) documents to determine if a Production Line Validation (PLV) will be required. The Manufacturing Engineer will be expected to lead these PLV events at Lockheed Martin and supplier sites. Other Responsibilities/Activities: Create and/or maintain Manufacturing Engineering Statement of Work and Make/Buy documents Perform Make or Buy analysis, which may include trade studies Proposal support Submit design Change Requests (CRs) and review engineering Change Notices (CNs) Support tooling efforts Aid in affordability and process improvement initiatives Support technical interchange meetings with suppliers and/or the customer Work with Production Operations, including hourly/union workforce May be called upon to create and/or present material to upper leadership and/or the customer Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in an associated discipline or equivalent combination of experience and education - Manufacturing background - shop floor experience preferred Demonstrated effective communication skills including verbal, listening, technical writing and presentations Ability to work independently as well as within a team environment Demonstrated effective interpersonal skills, including team building, collaboration and developing enduring business relationships Ability to liaison between LM Subcontractors, internal disciplines, and Production Operations Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve technical/process issues varying from basic to very complex Ability to interpret drawings, electrical schematics, wiring diagrams, product/performance specifications and other systems integration technical data Strong project/time management skills Proficient in MS Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) Ability to travel domestically and/or internationally Experience with Computer Aided Design (CAD) modeling Desired Skills: Bachelor's or higher degree in technical discipline (mechanical engineering, manufacturing engineering, electrical engineering, chemical engineering, etc.) Experience in design for manufacturing / assembly or design to cost Experience in Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) Experience with machining, welding, casting, and/or mechanical assembly Knowledge of the SAP MRP production control system Experience working with Government customers Self-motivated, performs work with general direction Ability to effectively communicate technical information to non-technical personnel Earned Value Management and/or Control Account Manager (CAM) experience Experience with proposals / estimating Lean / Six Sigma Green or Black Belt Certification Ability to obtain a security clearance Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Clearance Level: Secret Other Important Information You Should Know Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings. Ability to Work Remotely: Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process. Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits. Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. At Lockheed Martin, we use our passion for purposeful innovation to help keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel, develop, and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. We place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering an inclusive environment built upon integrity and corporate responsibility. If this sounds like a culture you connect with, you’re invited to apply for this role. Or, if you are unsure whether your experience aligns with the requirements of this position, we encourage you to search on Lockheed Martin Jobs, and apply for roles that align with your qualifications. System Integration/Test Engineer-HW Sr - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews 1701 W Marshall Dr, Grand Prairie, TX 75051 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time Missiles and Fire Control (MFC) is one of four Lockheed Martin business areas. We are a recognized designer, developer and manufacturer of precision engagement aerospace and defense systems for the U.S. and allied militaries. MFC develops, manufactures and supports advanced combat, missile, rocket, manned and unmanned systems for military customers that include the U.S. Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, NASA and dozens of foreign allies. Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire in Grand Prairie, Texas is seeking an experienced Staff Software Engineer who will be supporting detailed software design and hardware/software integration/verification for the missile test systems in support of testing the PAC-3/MSE Missile and subsystems. Applicant should be a proven problem solver who can multi-task in a complex interrelated environment. Candidates should be skilled in test equipment design, interface test adapter (ITA) design, and interfacing with test equipment. Candidates must understand electronics testing methods. Requires knowledge of industry wide tests and test equipment. Candidate will provide flow charts, block diagrams, schematics, and interface control documents. This role will support the writing of test description documents, operating instruction, and installation procedures. This role will support Peer Reviews, Design Assurance Reviews, Pre/Post Verification Readiness Reviews, etc. Candidate provides technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Solutions are imaginative, thorough, practicable, and consistent with organization objectives. Candidate is expected to work under only general direction. This role will be required to work to the assigned tasks as laid out in the Integrated Master Schedule (IMS) within constraints defined by the Test System Technical Lead. This role is expected to provide timely and frequent communication on progress and significant issues to the Test System Technical Lead and other Program and Functional Stakeholders to prevent surprises. Candidate will be required to work with cross functional teams - Test System Technical Lead, Systems Engineering (SE) SME, Unit Under Test (UUT) SME, Group Technical Staff (GTS), and Functional Design Assurance SME - to ensure the test system design is in-line with Enterprise standards and to ensure the test system meets requirements. Candidate will occasionally be required to travel to Lockheed Martin production facilities, supplier’s facilities, and customer facilities. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Electrical Engineering or related degrees or combined equivalent education and experience Skills in troubleshooting Analog and Digital Electronics Test system hardware design Familiarity with test software design and proficiency with software debugging in support of troubleshooting Skilled in Root Cause and Corrective Action Test Equipment Interface Test Adapter (ITA) and cable design experience. Hardware and software configuration management process Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint Ability to obtain a secret security clearance. Desired Skills: Familiarity with National Instruments test equipment hardware Experience in troubleshooting and failure investigation in support of developmental engineering as well as production manufacturing Requirements Management Applications (DOORS, NI Requirements Gateway) Strong background in cross -discipline systems engineering practices including requirements development/maintenance, architecture, test equipment hardware/software design, integration and verification Microsoft VISIO, Excel, Project, PowerPoint skills LabVIEW/Test Stand Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Clearance Level: Secret Other Important Information You Should Know Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings. Ability to Work Remotely: Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process. Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits. Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. Sr. Procurement Engineer/Supplier Quality/Aerospace/Grand Prairie, TX - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews 1701 W Marshall Dr, Grand Prairie, TX 75051 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time Are you seeking new, challenging opportunities in Supply Chain Management? Do you desire to work at a respected company with traditional values, but an innovative mindset? Does the idea of actual rocket science seem exciting to you? Lockheed Martin’s Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD) Global Supply Chain team is looking for a passionate, detail-oriented problem-solver to add to its Procurement Engineering team. Procurement engineers serve as technical support to the GSC team chartered with reducing risk in the supply base. Candidate must have a strong organizational aptitude with excellent written and verbal communication skills, a desire to lead projects of varying complexity, and a thorough understanding of production processes, engineering design, and development processes. In this role, the candidate must be able to facilitate and support supplier issue evaluation and resolution, participate in change management, identify affordability opportunities, and perform capacity and capability analysis at a minimum. Other tasks include development and management of Statement of Requirements (SOR), process improvement or corrective action activities, supplier selection activities, PO Kickoff, and supporting the GSC operations team and initiatives. Basic Qualifications: Ability to obtain a secret clearance Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education Requirements development / management Experience with writing technical documents Excellent communication skills MS Office proficiency Ability to work proactively /self-motivated Excellent teamwork and team leadership skill Desired Skills: Background/Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering or similar field Experience with capacity analysis tools Risk Management Global Supply Chain experience related to acquisitions, proposals, and execution of a contract Comprehensive knowledge of requirements flow downs Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.
